author: Thomas
title: Cardano Catalyst Newsletter
description: Entrepreneurs are looking for fundraising and are not aware about Cardano & Catalyst.

assessments.note:
Good draft and ideas. I think it is a good proposal - to reach people using newsletter, just I think there are better ideas, thus more effective. 

And only 12 newsletter per 3 months = 4/month. Consider budget.
assessments.reply:
"... there are better ways": What would be a more effective way? 
"consider budget" What does it mean? Is it expensive? Is it not sufficient? The idea was to think big, but start small, measure, learn and then iterate and apply again in an upcoming Fund.

assessments.note: A well-written Project Catalyst targeted newsletter could indeed lead to an increase in awareness and would most likely be welcomed by the Cardano community.
Proposer stated people aren't aware of Cardano. How does a newsletter change this. Where is the plan to get the newsletter to people who don't currently know about Cardano.
assessments.reply:
as written what is going to happen in week 1: Potential: partner with 60-Day Online Marketing Campaign (F5- proposer outreach) for the case that both proposals are going to be selected. (Disclaimer: both work also individually independent from each other)
influencer outreach to (a) inform them about planned activities, (b) ask for information (to be potentially shown on newsletter) and (c) ask for active communication/referral

The idea is to take entrepreneurs, startup-websites, vc ... which are not yet covering Cardano and add this. Maybe this was not stated clearly enough by myself.

assessments.note:
Although I think that might be important to have a newsletter about Catalys (I had no idea how big the ROI of it was), I believe that would be good if you find other methods to get the email addresses. Saying this because, since you have better detailed in the comments how you intend to get them, it seems to me that the sources used are very niched and that might not outreach that much. This is because we're using mainly the people and platforms which are already inside the community. 
Maybe would be interesting to create a content for small business in which you promote the projects being funded and marketing in a way that they can find a solution to their business or they may create a solution as well.
assessments.reply: "A curated newsletter facilitates access to information about Cardano in general and Project Catalyst in particular." In the first version of this proposal it was desribed more in length to market projects and running campaigns... To increase the readibility I reduced the amount of information a lot. Next time I add an URL to a google document.

assessments.note: A newsletter could indeed help already interested people stay updated on what happens in Cardano / Catalyst, thus improving brand awareness and the reach of initiatives

It is clearly a proplem that it is hard to onboard people from outside our ecosystem. A proper newsletter would help our community to grow and reach people that aren't aware of Project catalyst yet. A newsletter can always scale as more and more writers join the project.

The author's intentions dialogue a lot with the challenge's objectives, which are, basically, to get new investors for the Catalyst project and increase its visibility. According to the author, newsletters increase loyalty with (old and new) members, the engagement and credibility of the community. I believe that this is due to the fact that the content is better formulated and transmitted in more "formal" ways and with uniform consistency. In this view, the author's ideas respond very well to what was asked for. What seems to me a detail to think about is: how to get the contact, the email of these new people, because they would be interested in receiving content from the Catalyst project on a repetitive basis, without having established an initial interest? If the newsletter is linked to more consolidated media, such as the youtube channel or telegram, I think the idea would work even more efficiently.
assessments.reply:
The reach is a challenge (of every nuewsletter).
The idea with Telegram is helpful. I am going use Telegram and discord to market the newsletter in case of successful funding. 
Regarding YouTube I am going to partner with existing channels covering Cardano projects and referring to Catalyst projects in order to greate a win-win situation.

assessments.note: Given the linkedin profile, I have trust that he can deliver what is he is proposing.

The proposer has a lot of experience and has presented many facts about a targeted newsletter. While I think the proposal has a high likelihood of being implemented, the newsletter itself would benefit of extra exposure in order to attract as many people as possible to the ecosystem.
assessments.reply: I like the "extra exposure" comment and therefore Chales H. or Fred G. would be two among the best candidates to announce it in one of their upcoming interviews. (already stated in my comments underneath the proposal, but should probably be part of it directly)

assessments.note:
I wish you had given more detail in the budget.
After the 14 weeks, which are coherent with the budget asked, will the mailing stop and the project will end?
How will it self-fund in the future in order to make it continuous?
assessments.reply:
Growth potential (for continuation and further funding). 

Wave 1: F5 - think big, start small (covered with this F5 proposal)
Wave 2: F7 - improve + start decentralisation
Wave 3: F9 - full decentralisation + scale

As we do not yet know if it will help the proposer outreach it does not make sense to plan wave 2 + 3 in detail. We need to act agile and adapt on the way.

assessments.note: The proposer seems to be very experienced, and the plan is detailed. Goals seems maybe too much optimistic, but I would call the proposal helpful even if those are not necessarily met 100%.

While there is only the proposer behind the project at the beginning he plans to onboard more people and after the newsletter is established the proposer wants to give control to the community. The proposer introduced himself by providing his linkedin profile and he has years of experience in the relevant fields.
There is a sensible budget plan and the budget does not shoot over the top.

The author claims to work directly with business leadership and writing written content for developers and CEOS, which fits perfectly with his proposal. Also attached to his LinkedIn profile, where you can see some places he has studied and some examples of his work. Thus, someone is shown to be competent to take the lead of the project. Regarding the formation of time, the author is interested in including some volunteers from the community and editors. What was not very clear to me is whether these volunteers would work for free or be paid, which would be right for me.
assessments.reply: I could have provided more information about the volunteers. But they are in wave 2 (not in socpe for F5)

assessments.note: metrics to use refereall code/hashtag could work, even someone would just skip it. So there would be some deviances from reality, but I think it can work.

The proposal is well thought and has many aspects described in detail. The budget, the metrics, the growth potential, they all seem right. Indeed, this proposal could work great with another proposal that focuses specifically on marketing campaigns and visibility. It's god to see his willingness to partner with another proposal, something that could potentially benefit the both of them.
assessments.reply: You nailed it. Together with the 60-days online marketing campaign, we could increase the proposer outreach.

assessments.note: Without a plan to reach potential proposers who do not know about Cardano how does this address the challenge
assessments.reply: "...start of communication "register for mailing list" via (a) influencers, (b) content partners (c) cardano community. Risk: not enough subscribers (mitigation: post in relevant comments at YouTube, Blogs, Tweets + ask Charles, Fred to announce new newsletter) ; Potential: organic growth"

assessments.note: The plan is very detailed, the budget is partitioned, milestones and deliverables are there. Success metrics are sensible and clearly defined. It is definitely easy to see if this project met the goals it had at the start and there is enough information even for starters to judge the feasibility of it (e.g. pros and cons, why a newsletter, personal information about proposer)
assessments.reply: great summary. It is like a guideline for wirting another proposal in the future.

assessments.note: The proposal has a great structure. It cointains a succes metric, an outlook and a clear roadmap where the different approaches are listed. The proposal lists the problem at the beginning an then lays down how their goals are going to be achieved and the problem solved.
assessments.reply: great summary. It is like a guideline for wirting another proposal in the future.

assessments.note: The author details the step by step of the realization of his project, from how the newsletter would circulate, what would be written, how to measure the success of the action and so on. Also specific to how much money will be allocated to each part of the process, making it easier to follow the progress of the project. It touches on several points, such as relevant topics for the newsletter, steak pools, types of media involved and etc ... In other words, the parts of the whole are very clear and it is possible to understand with linearity and logic how the idea will proceed.

solution: A curated newsletter increases awareness, builds trust and drives entrepreneurs to Project Catalyst and the Cardano ecosystem.
experience:
15 years+ in business & technology.

10 years+ writing summaries on a weekly base for technical and non-technical decision makers.
